member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.DisableMultiFileMode
member.summary:
Disable the Multi-File mode of the STG
Switch the STG back to normal mode. In this mode, trigger inputs are assigned to channels, not to segments.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.EnableMultiFileMode(Mcs.Usb.Stg200xMultiFileSubmodeEnumNet)
member.summary:
Enable the Multi-File mode of the STG.
In Multi-File mode, the trigger inputs switch between segments. To use this mode, define up to as many segments as trigger inputs are available and fill each segment with a stimulus pattern.
Now a trigger on trigger input 1 switches the STG to the first segment and starts all triggers in this segment. Likewise, a trigger on trigger input 2, 3 and 4 selects the respective segment and start all triggers in this segment So the Multi-File Mode can be used to predefine up to four different stimuli which can be selected without the need for a computer connection.
member.param: The submode. Submode 0 is regular Multi-File mode as described above, submode 1 is extended Multi-File mode, where the segment is selected based on the digital pattern on the digital inputs. In this mode, 256 different segments can be defined and used.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.SegmentSelect(System.UInt32,Mcs.Usb.Stg200xSegmentFlagsEnumNet)
member.summary: Switchs segment.
member.param: The number of the segment to select.
A bitmap of flags, bit 1: assign all channels to the trigger number equal to the segment.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.SegmentStart(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,Mcs.Usb.Stg200xSegmentFlagsEnumNet)
member.summary: Switchs segment and starts trigger.
member.param: A bitmap of triggers that will be started.
The number of the segment to select.
A bitmap of flags, bit 1: assign all channels to the trigger number equal to the segment.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.SegmentDefine(System.UInt32[])
member.summary:
Defines the segment memory layout of the STG.
On reset, the STG has one segment containing all available memory.
With this command, the STG memory can be devided into several segments. Each segment can be filled with stimulus data.
member.param: The List of memory sizes (one per segment).

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadNet.ClearChannel_PrepareAndSendData(System.UInt32,System.Int32[],System.UInt64[],Mcs.Usb.STG_DestinationEnumNet,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepare and append data to a given channel on the STG.
member.para: Each datapoint is represented by an signed 32bit integer value. When using voltage stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 uV, thus the possible range is += 2000 V. When using current stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 nA, this the possible range is += 2000 mA.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.

Blocks of data which should repeat can be defined by prepending such a block with an entry in the arrays where both amplitude and duration is zero. The end of such an block is marked by an entry where the duration is set to zero and the amplitude beeing set to the number of times the block should run. Blocks can be nested.
member.param: The channel number to send data to.
A list of amplitudes in units of µV and nA in voltage and current mode, respectively.
A list of durations in units of µs.
specifies wheather the data is for syncout, current or voltage stimulation.

The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.

The end of such an block is marked by an entry where the duration is set to zero and the amplitude beeing set to the number of times the block should run. Blocks can be nested.
member.param: The channel number to send data to.
A list of amplitudes in units of µV and nA in voltage and current mode, respectively.
A list of durations in units of µs.
specifies wheather the data is for syncout, current or voltage stimulation.

The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.

member.summary: defines stimulation pulse pattern for voltage or current stimulation; CAUTION: zero-length amplitude will be briefly applied -> choose matching to neighbour to avoid spikes
member.param: index of hardware chamber slot (zero-based); send pattern to connected amp

amplitude; unit in voltage clamp: uV; unit in current clamp: nA

defines values on digital channel for each step (positive: digital channel "01", neg: "10", zero: "00")

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.SetupRetriggerMode(Mcs.Usb.RetriggerActionEnumNet,Mcs.Usb.RetriggerActionEnumNet)
member.summary:
Define the action on triggers while the STG is running.
The STG has three options how to handle a successive trigger while a trigger is active.
stop this trigger (default action)
restart this trigger
ignore the signal
member.param: Action for successive triggers in Normal Mode, and for triggers to the currently selected segment in Multi - File Mode.
Action for successive triggers in Multi-File Mode for a trigger on a segment not currently selected.Not used in Normal Mode.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.SetupRetriggerMode(System.SByte,Mcs.Usb.RetriggerActionEnumNet,Mcs.Usb.RetriggerActionEnumNet)
member.summary:
Define the action on triggers while the STG is running.
The STG has three options how to handle a successive trigger while a trigger is active.
stop this trigger (default action)
restart this trigger
ignore the signal
member.param: Action for successive triggers in Normal Mode, and for triggers to the currently selected segment in Multi - File Mode.
Action for successive triggers in Multi-File Mode for a trigger on a segment not currently selected.Not used in Normal Mode.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.DisableAutoReset
member.summary:
Disable AutoReset of the STG Status.
If autoreset is disabled, the STG status switches to FINISHED after the defined number of sweeps is finished. To switch back to the IDLE status, use CStg200xDownload::ResetStatus()

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.EnableAutoReset
member.summary:
Enable AutoReset of the STG Status.
This is the default on power up. If autoreset is enabled, the STG status switches to FINISHED only for one poll cycle after this, it switches to IDLE automatically.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.SendChannelData(System.UInt32,System.UInt16[],System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Uploads analog data (stimulus patterns) to the STG.
Sends datapoints to a given channel on the STG. The list of datapoints will be sent to the selected channel. Data previously sent to the channel is overwritten.
Each datapoint is represented by an integer value in the range from 0 to 4095 (bit 0 to 11), its sign is taken from bit 12, 0 is for positive amplitude, and 1 for negative amplitude Bits 13 to 15 have to be zero.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.
member.param: Specifies the channel to append the data to.
A list of durations as int64_t. The time is given in units of µs.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.ClearChannelData(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Delete a stimulus pattern for a channel from STG memory

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.SendSyncData(System.UInt32,System.UInt16[],System.UInt64[])
member.summary:
Uploads sync output data to the STG.
Sends sync output data to a given channel on the STG. The list of datapoints will be sent to the selected sync output channel. Sync output data previously sent to the channel is overwritten.
Each datapoint is represented by an integer value and can be either 0 or 1.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs. If your application can not handle 64 bit integers, use the STG200x_SendSyncData32() call instead.
member.param: Specifies the sync output channel to append the data to.
A list of durations as int64_t. The time is given in units of µs.

member.summary: Delete a SyncOut pattern for a channel from STG memory.
member.param: Specifies the syncout channel to clear.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xDownloadBasicNet.GetSweepCount(System.UInt32[]@,System.UInt32[]@)
member.summary:
Get the sweep and trigger count of the STG.
The triggercount tells how many times each trigger was active and is reset to zero on download of new channel data.
The sweepcount tells how many times each trigger was already repeated. This count is set to zero on trigger and counts up to repeat in CStg200xDownloadBasicNet::SetupTrigger.
member.param: on return contains the number of sweeps for each trigger.
on return contains the number of trigger events seen for each trigger.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStg200xBasicNet.SendStop(System.UInt32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Stop some or all triggers of the STG.
member.param: A bitmap of triggers which will be stopped.

bitmap of options, currently only STOP_OPTION_SAVESTOP (0x80) is defined, which bypasses the stop commands when a syncout assossiated with a given sync-out has bit 1 (0x02) set. Can be used e.g. to prevent a stop while a biphasic stimulation pulse is active..

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CMeaDeviceNet.CHWInfo.GetAvailableVoltageRangesInMicroVoltAndStringsInMilliVolt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a List of voltage ranges the device supports.
member.remarks: The List is scaled by the gain factor given as argument to this function. Use "1000" as scale factor for backwards compatibility. Each list entry contains the voltage range as an integer and as a string. To get a list of voltage ranges for the headstage, obtain the gain of the headstage with the GetGain() call and use the result in the milliGain parameter. To get a list of voltage ranges for the analog inputs of the interfaceboard, obtain the gain of the analog inputs with the GetAnalogGain() call and use the result in the milliGain parameter.
member.param: The gain factor (in milliGain) used to scale the list of voltage ranges.
member.returns: List of voltage ranges in µV.

To get a list of voltage ranges for the analog inputs of the interfaceboard, obtain the gain of the analog inputs with the GetAnalogGain() call and use the result in the milliGain parameter.
member.param: The gain factor (in milliGain) used to scale the list of voltage ranges.
member.returns: List of voltage ranges in µV.

member.name: T:Mcs.Usb.CMeaDeviceNet
member.summary: Base class for MEA data acquisition devices.
member.remarks: There are two different device types for MEA data aquistion devices. There are the USB-MEA devices and the MC_Card. In .NET both classes can be accessed by the contructor of the base class CMeaDeviceNet, which contructs the correct underlying C++ class for the USB-MEA device on the one hand or the MC_Card device on the other hand. Through this interface both device types USB-MEA devices and MC_Card devices can be accessed

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStimulusFunctionNet.CreateSideband(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.UInt64[],System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Creates the Sideband Channel for the MEA2100 device.
Each datapoint is represented by an signed 32bit integer value. A value 1 means that the stimulation is active during that time. A value 0 means that the stimulation is not active during that time.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.
member.param: A list of datapoints which define weather the Stimulus is active or idle at that time as int32.
A list of syncouts as int32. They define additional syncout.
A list of durations as uint64. The time is given in units of µs.
Time in µs for which Bit 0 (Blanking) is to be extended.
Time in µs for which Bit 3 (Stimulus Enable) is to be extended.
Time in µs for which Bit 4 (Stimulus Selector) is to be extended.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStimulusFunctionNet.PrepareAndAppendData(System.UInt32,System.Int32[],System.UInt64[],Mcs.Usb.STG_DestinationEnumNet)
member.summary: Prepare and append data to a given channel on the STG.
member.para: Each datapoint is represented by an signed 32bit integer value. When using voltage stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 uV, thus the possible range is += 2000 V. When using current stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 nA, this the possible range is += 2000 mA.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.

Blocks of data which should repeat can be defined by prepending such a block with an entry in the arrays where both amplitude and duration is zero. The end of such an block is marked by an entry where the duration is set to zero and the amplitude beeing set to the number of times the block should run. Blocks can be nested.
member.param: The channel number to send data to.
A list of amplitudes in units of µV and nA in voltage and current mode, respectively.
A list of durations in units of µs.
specifies wheather the data is for syncout, current or voltage stimulation.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CStimulusFunctionNet.PrepareAndSendData(System.UInt32,System.Int32[],System.UInt64[],Mcs.Usb.STG_DestinationEnumNet)
member.summary:
Prepare and send data to a given channel on the STG. Previous data sent to that channel is erased first.
Each datapoint is represented by an signed 32bit integer value. When using voltage stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 uV, thus the possible range is += 2000 V. When using current stimulation, the values are in multiple of 1 nA, this the possible range is += 2000 mA.
The duration is given as a list of 64 bit integers. Durations are given in units of µs. The STG has a resolution of 20 µs.
Blocks of data which should repeat can be defined by prepending such a block with an entry in the arrays where both amplitude and duration is zero. The end of such an block is marked by an entry where the duration is set to zero and the amplitude beeing set to the number of times the block should run. Blocks can be nested.
member.param: The channel number to send data to.
A list of amplitudes in units of µV and nA in voltage and current mode, respectively.
A list of durations in units of µs.
specifies wheather the data is for syncout, current or voltage stimulation.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CMcsUsbDacqNet.ChannelBlockNet.SetSelectedChannelsQueue(System.Boolean[],System.Int32,System.Int32,Mcs.Usb.SampleSizeNet,Mcs.Usb.SampleDstSizeNet,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a common FIFO queue for all channels. Data in callback will be a list per channel. Use ChannelBlock_ReadFramesDict... with handle = 0 to read the data.
member.remarks: When using 32 bit data format, ChannelsInBlock is still the number of 16 bit channels per frame, as obtained from GetChannelsInBlock, while nChannels is the number of 32 bit channels to be read from the device. So when all channels from a device are read in 32 bit data format nChannels = ChannelsInBlock/2
member.param: List of channels to be collected in the FIFO.
Size of sample frames the FIFO can hold.
Number of sample frames the FIFO must acquire before the callback function is called.
size of the datawords, either 16, 24 or 32bit.
size of the destination datawords, either 16 or 32bit.

member.name: M:Mcs.Usb.CMcsUsbDacqNet.GetSampleratePerFramerate(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Queries the ratio between samplerate and framerate.
Devices with a samplerate higher than framerate send multiple samples of the the channels in one frame. Use this call to determine the number of samples for each channel in one frame. The multiple samples for the same channel are sent in one continous block followed by a block for the next channel.
